| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line691](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line691 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **sabre-toothed cat**, f, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a large [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

Saber-toothed cats possess a two strong claw attacks and a bite attack.

## Generation

Randomly-generated saber-toothed cats are not generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

## Strategy

Sabre-toothed cats move at the same speed as [you](/wiki/You "You") and are significantly tougher than other felines, doing twice the damage of a [tiger](/wiki/Tiger "Tiger") with twice the hit points on average - a player who is not sufficiently prepared to engage one in melee may meet their death quickly. Fortunately, their lack of [monster MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") leaves them very vulnerable to wands and spells, and a [fast](/wiki/Fast "Fast") player can reliably outrun them while using [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") at will. Their [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of 6 is also mediocre enough that a well-armored character with a decently-enchanted weapon can fight them off even in melee.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Saber-toothed cat](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saber-toothed_cat "wikipedia:Saber-toothed cat")***

*Machairodontinae* is an extinct subfamily of carnivorous mammals within the family Felidae (also known as "true cats"), and contains many of the extinct predators commonly known as "saber-toothed cats", including the famed genus *[Smilodon](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smilodon "wikipedia:Smilodon")*. These saber-toothed cats are the best-known genera of [saber-toothed predators](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saber-toothed_predators "wikipedia:Saber-toothed predators") and were found across most of the world, living from about 16 million until about 11,000 years ago. The species is named for their massive canine teeth: *Machairodontinae* means "dagger-tooth" and is derived from the Greek μάχαιρα (machaira, "sword").

Previously, some species of saber-toothed cats were called "saber-toothed tigers", though machairodonts are not closely related to any living feline species; DNA analysis published in 2005 confirmed and clarified that the Machairodontinae diverged early from the ancestors of modern cats in their evolution.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Sabre-toothed cat

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
f sabre-toothed cat
Difficulty 11
Attacks Claw 4d4, Claw 4d4, Bite 2d10
f sabre-toothed cat
Difficulty 11
Attacks

Claw 4d4, Claw 4d4, Bite 2d10

Base level 9
Base experience 186
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 800
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A sabre-toothed cat:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line691

A sabre-toothed cat, f, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is a large carnivorous feline that can be seen via infravision.

Saber-toothed cats possess a two strong claw attacks and a bite attack.

Generation

Randomly-generated saber-toothed cats are not generated in Gehennom.

Strategy

Sabre-toothed cats move at the same speed as you and are significantly tougher than other felines, doing twice the damage of a tiger with twice the hit points on average - a player who is not sufficiently prepared to engage one in melee may meet their death quickly. Fortunately, their lack of monster MR leaves them very vulnerable to wands and spells, and a fast player can reliably outrun them while using ranged attacks at will. Their AC of 6 is also mediocre enough that a well-armored character with a decently-enchanted weapon can fight them off even in melee.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Saber-toothed cat

Machairodontinae is an extinct subfamily of carnivorous mammals within the family Felidae (also known as "true cats"), and contains many of the extinct predators commonly known as "saber-toothed cats", including the famed genus Smilodon. These saber-toothed cats are the best-known genera of saber-toothed predators and were found across most of the world, living from about 16 million until about 11,000 years ago. The species is named for their massive canine teeth: Machairodontinae means "dagger-tooth" and is derived from the Greek μάχαιρα (machaira, "sword").

Previously, some species of saber-toothed cats were called "saber-toothed tigers", though machairodonts are not closely related to any living feline species; DNA analysis published in 2005 confirmed and clarified that the Machairodontinae diverged early from the ancestors of modern cats in their evolution.

A '''sabre-toothed cat''', {{monsym|sabre-toothed cat}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a large [[carnivorous]] [[feline]] that can be seen via [[infravision]].

Saber-toothed cats possess a two strong claw attacks and a bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated saber-toothed cats are not generated in [[Gehennom]].

==Strategy==
Sabre-toothed cats move at the same speed as [[you]] and are significantly tougher than other felines, doing twice the damage of a [[tiger]] with twice the hit points on average - a player who is not sufficiently prepared to engage one in melee may meet their death quickly. Fortunately, their lack of [[Magic resistance (monster)|monster MR]] leaves them very vulnerable to wands and spells, and a [[fast]] player can reliably outrun them while using [[ranged attack]]s at will. Their [[AC]] of 6 is also mediocre enough that a well-armored character with a decently-enchanted weapon can fight them off even in melee.

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Saber-toothed cat}}
''Machairodontinae'' is an extinct subfamily of carnivorous mammals within the family Felidae (also known as "true cats"), and contains many of the extinct predators commonly known as "saber-toothed cats", including the famed genus ''[[wikipedia:Smilodon|Smilodon]]''. These saber-toothed cats are the best-known genera of [[wikipedia:Saber-toothed predators|saber-toothed predators]] and were found across most of the world, living from about 16 million until about 11,000 years ago. The species is named for their massive canine teeth: ''Machairodontinae'' means "dagger-tooth" and is derived from the Greek μάχαιρα (machaira, "sword").

Previously, some species of saber-toothed cats were called "saber-toothed tigers", though machairodonts are not closely related to any living feline species; DNA analysis published in 2005 confirmed and clarified that the Machairodontinae diverged early from the ancestors of modern cats in their evolution.
